docs.lead_paragraph: Drinking carbonated soft drinks and being overweight may be the two most prevalent causes of nighttime heartburn, according to a new study. Heartburn at night, or nocturnal gastroesophageal reflux, is quite common. An estimated 44 percent of Americans suffer from it at least once a month. But what causes it has not been extensively studied.

headline.main: Heartburn in the Night Tied to Soda in the Day

docs.snippet: Drinking carbonated soft drinks and being overweight may be the two most prevalent causes of nighttime heartburn, according to a new study.

docs.lead_paragraph: Infectious disease used to be a simple matter: this germ causes that illness. Doctors just had to find the germ, kill it, and cure the disease. But the old rules no longer apply.

headline.main: More Diseases Pinned on Old Culprit: Germs

docs.snippet: Germs, scientists are learning, are probably the cause of many illnesses that were never thought to be infectious.
